title: Sydney stunned by severe storm
text:
Share on Twitter 
FLASH floods are tearing through inner city streets, flooding cars and causing traffic chaos as thunderstorms collide with brutally hot air which has boiled the city for the last two days. 
About 50mm of rain fell in an hour before lunch at Marrickville, 35mm in Parramatta and 30mm at Rose Bay. Detailed Severe Thunderstorm Warning Issued for Heavy Rainfall and Damaging Winds. https://t.co/Ss766eSCrL #SydneyStorm #Sydney pic.twitter.com/SIJ30QBJYk — BOM New South Wales (@BOM_NSW) February 6, 2017 
A host of major roads have been impacted by the storms, among them the Anzac Bridge, James Ruse Drive and Parramatta Rd. 
“The thunderstorms combined with the humid air over the city is causing this,” Bureau of Meteorology forecaster Mohammed Nabi said. 
“When you get these sorts of downfalls, they can cause flash flooding in built-up areas.” 
More heavy downpours are expected today and tomorrow. People attempt to shelter from the rain at Central Station. Picture: John Fotiadis Source: News Corp Australia Heavy rain hitting the Redfern area causing flooding. Picture: John Grainger Source: News Corp Australia
